channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sinkhole, 28th January
item.description:
There is an area that has become sunk where manhole covers are - When buses pass over this area the houses in vicinity shudder. It's been going on for years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Green Dragon Lane, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crash barrier ,blocking road ,needs removing as has been hit soany times ,now a public danger ,as it has been moved in to the road, 28th January
item.description:
Crash barrier ,now blocking part of road corner of sholden gardens / Roberts close ,cars keep hitting it ,needs urgent removal ,and will create additional car parking when gone

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roberts Close, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Slip waste very dangerous, 28th January

item.title: Uneven pavement slabs, 28th January
item.description:
Few pavement slabs uneven. Meaning the is a trip hazard, I have had 2 people come to complain at me (i work in the shop where the issue is just outside) and I have seen one person trip and fall. Hard to show in pictures but they need to be evened out to prevent falls.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ballards Lane, Church End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive littering along Anerley Park Road, and Thicket Road, 28th January
item.description:
These two streets are in dire need of litter picking, every metre there is an item of litter; empty cigarette packets, beer cans, takeaway boxes etc.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Anerley Park Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish bags dimped, 28th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paget Rise, Plumstead

item.title: Lime Bike in the water, 28th January
item.description:
There is a Lime bike half-buried in the silt, in the quay inlet. You can only see it at low tide. It's been there for months. I'm worried it will leak battery chemicals into the Thames.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Sea Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
